intro: Discaria × andina, commonly known as the Andean discaria, is a hybrid shrub native to the highlands of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at elevations ranging from 2,000 to 4,000 meters. Its leaves are usually elliptical with a rough texture and often bear small, white or pale blue glands. Discaria × andina is adapted to harsh, high-altitude environments and is often used in traditional medicine by local communities.
